str2: Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A fall; a carcass, corpse, dead body. From the alternate of pipto; a ruin, i.e., lifeless body.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An eagle, bird of prey. From the same as aer; an eagle.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
